page.title: 04WALTON HALL AND GARDENS
page.content: Hall built in 1836 in 4750 acres by {Gilbert Greenall}(brewer).Sold in 1941 to Warrington Corporation.Grounds now open to public all year round with Hall open at specific times.Hall contains exhibition rooms and displays of period furniture.Grounds now cover 240 acres(170 acres of gardens) and are owned by Warrington Council Leisure Services Dept.Hothouses and greenhouses supply floral decoration for all civic events.Amenities in the Park include pitch and putt course, crazy golf,children's zoo,playground,bowling greens and cafe.Live entertainment is provided during the Summer months. 7 {'Park Rangers' }are employed to help run the park and organise '{ {educational visits' }by local schools.They are employed under the {'Manpower Services Commission'}
